Company Bio:
3BOTS develops systems for digitalizing and reproducing large objects. Among these are automated scanners and additive manufacturing tools.
 Modern technology is used to combine hardware and software with the robust components of mechanical engineering – made in Germany.
 Founded in 2016 as part of a 2D-printing business, 3BOTS was founded with more than 30 years of knowledge in hardware and software design, reproduction, image processing, and product development.
 We develop, design and build our machines in Berlin, which in collaboration with universities, connected development tools, and the collaboration with international suppliers allows for efficient advanced machines paired with excellent support at reasonable prices.

Company Bio:
Our target Market
 Our target market is that of high value-added components and medium to large components, in a variety of industrial sectors such as aeronautics, aerospace, energy, and shipbuilding, among others. We work with materials like steel, titanium alloys, superalloys and aluminum alloys. Our machines are fitted with a closed loop control system and an inert chamber with a special loading and unloading system. All of this ensures the top quality of the piece during the manufacturing process.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Our challenges
 • To offer an additive manufacturing system of metal preforms complying with the required mechanic standards in a dependable and repetitive way.
 • To provide a competitive manufacturing alternative for consumers and manufacturers of medium to large size high added value pieces.
 To this end, ADDILAN focuses its efforts on process development, machine design, and mechanical characterization.

Company Bio:
Aurburg entered the additive manufacturing realm with its new freeformer machine, which produces fully functional plastic parts using its proprietary new additive manufacturing technique – ARBURG Plastic Freeforming (AKF) – from 3D CAD files, from standard granulates and without a mould. It therefore offers boundless freedom for the efficient production of individual parts and small-volume batches.
In Italy Arburg is present through its italian branch, located at 31 B Via G.Vittorio in Peschiera Borromeo, near Milan, and can be reached via its italian website www.arburg.it.”

Company Bio: Atum3D is a leading company in industrial 3D Manufacturing, based on superior DLP technology. Our products are integral combinations of proprietary hardware, software, resins and services. Features include exceptional tolerance levels and speed, resin properties similar to ABS or PU and an integral batch manufacturing process resulting in ready-to-use components. Unprecedented cost efficiency, both in terms of investment and running costs, enable atum3D to rival traditional component manufacturing methods for the first time. Fixed costs become variable costs. Lead times and keeping stock turn into immediate manufacturing according to need.

Company Bio:
Aurora Labs Ltd (ASX:A3D) is an Australian based company specialising in the development of 3D metal printers, printer software and the supply of associated consumable materials.
 We are at the forefront of metal 3D printing technology, with several technologies under development including some of the most affordable metal printers available and revolutionary industrial grade, high speed, large format 3D metal printers that can be used for large-scale industrial manufacturing on a cost effective basis.
 
 We are at the forefront of metal 3D printing technology. We produce the S-Titanium Pro, one of the most versatile and affordable, high quality metal printers available. We are also developing revolutionary industrial grade, high speed, large format 3D metal printers, powder manufacturing and control software that can be used for large-scale industrial manufacturing on a cost-effective basis.
 A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS
 
 Our outstanding team is built of inspired Materials Scientists and Surface Engineering specialists, Computer Scientists, Mathematicians and Physicists, we.re driven by the urge to create new things in new ways to meet extraordinary technical challenges.
 
 Mission:
 
 Aurora Labs was created to make 3D metal printing accessible for developers, researchers and creators as well as move 3D printing into high volume manufacturing.
 
 Vision:
 
 We believe we’re on the cusp of another manufacturing revolution – one that takes 3D printing to new heights. We have developed the ability to print multiple metals at the same time, the most affordable metal printers available in their class and are developing what would be the fastest and largest print envelope 3D metal printers available.
